messages.subject: Need help judging Katana age
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, I m new to this group and I have a question regarding a recently purchased Katana. I purchased the sword from a WW2 veteran who was stationed in Japan
messages.messageBody:
Hi,
I'm new to this group and I have a question regarding a recently
purchased Katana. I purchased the sword from a WW2 veteran who was
stationed in Japan during and post surrender. My question is that I
don't know how old the sword is, even though I can see that it's
extremely old but I can't put an exact date on the sword. If anyone
can help me with this matter I would be deeply grateful. I uploaded
close up pictures of the sword into the folder "Bladeben Katana" in
the photo section. The sword is 25.5 inches in total length and the
blade is 20.5 inches long. Also, if anyone can tell me from the
shape, hamon pattern etc. who might have made the sword? I ask this
as the tang is not signed or might have been but lost over time. I
eagerly await any responses.

Thanks
Ben (bladeben)
